member.name: T:ImageMso.Excel.Images
member.summary: Encapsulates collections, methods and structures to extract ImageMso icons from the Microsoft Excel application.

remarks.para: The collection of 8,899 distinct ImageMso names in this class are a composite list formed by the union of values collected from "2007 Office System Add-In: Icons Gallery", "Office 2010 Add-In: Icons Gallery", "Appendix A: Custom UI Control ID Tables, [MS-CUSTOMUI]: imageMso Table" and "Microsoft Office Document: [MS-CUSTOMUI2] Supporting Documentation".

The methods and structures in this class are based off the answer provided on Stack Overflow by Ismail Degani in response to the question "How to save ImageMSO icon from Microsoft Office 2007?" which was in turn based off the MSDN blog post "Preserving the alpha channel when converting images" by Andrew Whitechapel.
remarks.seealso: Appendix A: Custom UI Control ID Tables, [MS-CUSTOMUI]: imageMso Table
How to save ImageMSO icon from Microsoft Office 2007?
Preserving the alpha channel when converting images

member.name: M:ImageMso.Excel.Images.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Intended only for use by the static property.
member.remarks: The constructor builds the complete sorted collection of distinct ImageMso names supported by the host Microsoft Office version by constructing from the partial collections and excluding the excluded ImageMso names for the host version of Microsoft Office. The exceedingly complex expressions, for applications settings such as the entire collection of distinct ImageMso names, are beyond the abilities of Visual Studio to compile as a whole but are workable in parts.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Item(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a copy of the ImageMso from Microsoft Excel at the specified width and height.
member.returns: This method returns a image of the specified ImageMso copied from Microsoft Excel with the specified width and height or null if the specified ImageMso is not supported by the host version of Microsoft Office.
member.remarks: This method wraps the static method for instantiated classes.

member.name: M:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Draw(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a copy of the ImageMso from Microsoft Excel at the specified width and height.
member.returns: This method returns a image of the specified ImageMso copied from Microsoft Excel with the specified width and height or null if the specified ImageMso is not supported by the host version of Microsoft Office.
member.remarks: This method gets the from the Microsoft Excel application, checks if the image is 24bpp RGB or 32bpp ARGB and copies the image pixel for pixel to a new Bitmap to preserve or discard the alpha channel.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Copyright

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Names
member.summary: Gets the collection of distinct ImageMso names supported by the host version of Microsoft Office.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.NamesTop
member.summary: Gets the top partial collection of 4,422 distinct ImageMso names from _ to K.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.NamesBottom
member.summary: Gets the bottom partial collection of 4,477 distinct ImageMso names from L to Z.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Exclude2007
member.summary: Gets the collection of 5,604 distinct ImageMso names not supported by Microsoft Office 2007.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Exclude2010
member.summary: Gets the collection of 466 distinct ImageMso names not supported by Microsoft Office 2010.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Exclude2013
member.summary: Gets the collection of 5 distinct ImageMso names not supported by Microsoft Office 2013.

member.name: P:ImageMso.Excel.Images.Exclude2016
member.summary: Gets the collection of 5 distinct ImageMso names not supported by Microsoft Office 2013.
